title: NYSDOT Regional Offices
name: NYSDOT Regional Offices
description: Location information from NYSDOT website; spending analysis by Tri-State Transportation Campaign based on NYSDOT's 2011-2014 STIP and 2014-2017 Draft STIP.

properties.name: Capital District: Region 1
properties.description: In the 2011-2014 STIP, 1.31% of the total dollars are allocated to bicycle/pedestrians projects. 4.14% of the total dollars in the Draft 2014-2018 STIP will go to these kinds of projects. In the 2011-2014 STIP, 13.44% of the total dollars are allocated to road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements. 2.38% of the total dollars in the 2014-2017 Draft STIP will go to these kinds of projects.

properties.name: Mohawk Valley: Region 2
properties.description: In the 2011-2014 STIP, .63% of the total dollars are allocated to bicycle/pedestrians projects. .30% of the total dollars in the Draft 2014-2018 STIP will go to these kinds of projects. In the 2011-2014 STIP and the Draft 2014-2017 STIP, no road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements were identified.

properties.name: Central New York: Region 3
properties.description: In the 2011-2014 STIP, 1.71% of the total dollars are allocated to bicycle/pedestrians projects. 1.92% of the total dollars in the Draft 2014-2017 STIP will go to these kinds of projects. In the 2011-2014 STIP, 3.69% of the total dollars are allocated to road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements. 2.76% of the total dollars in the 2014-2017 Draft STIP will go to these kinds of projects.

properties.name: Genesee Valley: Region 4
properties.description: In the 2011-2014 STIP, 1.94% of the total dollars are allocated to bicycle/pedestrians projects. .37% of the total dollars in the Draft 2014-2017 STIP will go to these kinds of projects. In the 2011-2014 STIP, .27% of the total dollars are allocated to road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements. No road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements were identified in the 2014-2017 Draft STIP.

In the 2011-2014 STIP, .97% of the total dollars are allocated to road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements. 1.23% of the total dollars in the 2014-2017 Draft STIP will go to these kinds of projects.

In the 2011-2014 STIP and the Draft 2014-2017 STIP, no road, bridge or transit projects that include bicycle/pedestrian elements were identified.
